title: Department of Physical-Technical Problems of Steel Metallurgy

firstPersonCard.name: Molchanov Lavr Serhiyovych
firstPersonCard.researchDirection: Theory and practice of converter processes, development of new and improvement of existing technologies and equipment for steel production in the directions of saving energy and material resources, improving quality.
firstPersonCard.specialization: 05.16.02 "Metallurgy of ferrous and non-ferrous metals and special alloys"

items: Development of theory and technology of high-temperature modeling of converter bath blowing and ladle iron refining.
Improving resource and energy conservation along the technological route of steel production blast furnace — oxygen converter.
Development, research and implementation of the latest resource and energy-efficient methods of influencing heat-physical, gas-dynamic and refining processes in the steelmaking bath.

Improving the efficiency of extra-furnace steel processing methods and improving steel casting processes through better use of alloying, deoxidizing, heat-insulating and refining materials — additives based on improving their technological properties.

Development of proposals and justification of non-standard composition of micro-alloying and refining compositions, formation of recommendations for the use of by-product non-standard products of ferroalloy production.

Determination and use of features of hydrodynamic and thermal state of ladle metal bath during steel processing on ladle-furnace unit, various types of vacuum units and other extra-furnace processing equipment, including due to the patterns and levers of influence on ongoing processes identified in this case, in order to improve metal quality and reduce material costs at these stages of steel production.

Justification of rational location of bottom blowing unit relative to places of introduction of lump and wire additions in steel casting ladles of different capacity and bath geometry; determination of energy-saving modes of blowing, heating, steel casting, etc.
